name: Incline Plank With Alternate Floor Touch
how_to_perform:
1. Start in an incline plank position with your hands placed shoulder-width apart on a surface that allows you to adjust the height (such as stairs or a bench). Place your feet hip-width apart with one foot resting on the floor and the other on the inclined surface.

2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips do not sag or pike upwards throughout the movement.

3. Slowly lift your right hand off the surface and touch your right toe to the floor directly underneath you.
4. Quickly return your raised hand to its original position without resting it on the surface.
5. Repeat with your left hand by lifting it off the surface and touching your left toe to the floor.
6. Continue alternating hands, touching one toe at a time, for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Incline plank with alternate floor touch is an exercise that targets the core muscles while performing leg lifts from an elevated position.
